page.title: 08FARMING - 1
page.content:
{FARMING (1) Martin's Farm. Our farm has 47.4 ha. and a mile and a half of beck. The farmhouse was built in 1663. Each year 35 - 40 calves are born and around 25 beef bullocks are sold. Our main concern is dairy cattle. A good cow can yield 8 gallons of milk a day, but a heifer after its first calf usually gives about 5 gallons. The E.E.C. milk quota, which sets limits on milk production, has affected us slightly. We buy food supplements from West Cumberland and Preston Farmers. Most of this is in the form of cow cake and sugar beet.
{Reported by Daniel Martin, aged 9, son {of the owner.
